content.title: Intro
content.content:
2 Yule was the first day in the Shire Calendar, marking the beginning of the year, followed by 1 January.[1][note 1] Due to the Shire-reform the Yuledays always fell on the same days of the week. 2 Yule was always a Sterday (Saturday).[2]

Events on 2 Yule:

T.A. 3019:
The Fellowship of the Ring travels south along the Misty Mountains.
First quarter of the Moon[3]

content.title: Notes
content.content: ↑ On a Gregorian calendar, it would approximately correspond to 22 December.

content.title: References
content.content:
↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, The Lord of the Rings, Appendix D, "The Shire Calendar"
↑ J.R.R. Tolkien, The Lord of the Rings, Appendix D, "The Calendars"
↑ Wayne G. Hammond and Christina Scull (eds), The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion, p. xlix
